item.title: States and cities beef up security to prepare for potential election-related violence

item.title: When will mail-in and absentee ballots be counted?

item.title: How has the Electoral College survived, despite being perennially unpopular?
item.description: Despite its substantial-sounding name, the Electoral College isn’t a permanent body: It’s more of a process. For decades, a majority of Americans have wanted it to be changed.
